metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1830 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Requests (aka python-requests) before 2.3.0 allows remote servers to obtain sensitive information by reading the Proxy-Authorization header in a redirected request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1830` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-requests - 2.3.0-1
python3-requests - 2.3.0-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: requests package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1').
